sub_topic: Calculate the Hodge star operator on a manifold.
message_1: Let $M$ be a 3-dimensional manifold. Find the Hodge star operator of the one-form $\omega = x^2\, dy + z\, dx + y^2z\, dz$ at the point $(1,1,1)$.
message_2:
To find the Hodge star operator of the one-form $\omega = x^2\, dy + z\, dx + y^2z\, dz$ at the point $(1,1,1)$, we first need to evaluate the one-form at this point. 

At $(1,1,1)$, we have:

$\omega(1,1,1) = (1)^2\, dy + (1)\, dx + (1)^2(1)\, dz = dy + dx + dz$

Now, we need to find the Hodge star operator of this one-form. In a 3-dimensional manifold, the Hodge star operator acts on one-forms as follows:

$*(dx) = dy \wedge dz$

$*(dy) = dz \wedge dx$

$*(dz) = dx \wedge dy$

Applying the Hodge star operator to $\omega(1,1,1)$:

$*(dy + dx + dz) = *(dy) + *(dx) + *(dz) = (dz \wedge dx) + (dy \wedge dz) + (dx \wedge dy)$

So, the Hodge star operator of the one-form $\omega$ at the point $(1,1,1)$ is:

$*(\omega) = dz \wedge dx + dy \wedge dz + dx \wedge dy$
